scenes.title: Three-front war, one new lever
scenes.main_point: AI raised expectations, broke distribution, and intensified competition; growth shifted to trust.
scenes.scene_summary: AI raised expectations, collapsed channels, and attacked value props; trust became the new playbook.
key_elements: competition from incumbents, startups, and customers
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In a modern startup office, a founder stands at a whiteboard as three opposing forces press in: an AI wave raising customer expectation charts, crumbling distribution pipelines, and rival silhouettes labeled incumbents, startups, customers.
The founder reaches for a single lever marked “TRUST,” tense but determined.

scenes.title: Trust-based acquisition replaces broken channels
scenes.main_point: SEO, SEM, and corporate social weakened; trust-forward channels drove word of mouth.
scenes.scene_summary: SEO, SEM, and corporate social weakened; employees, creators, community, and product experience drove word of mouth.
key_elements: SEO disrupted by AI content and answer engines
SEM costs rising and ROAS declining
word of mouth as ultimate trust signal
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In the same war-room from scene 1, the same startup team gathers around a whiteboard where “SEO,” “SEM,” and “Corporate Social” are crossed out, replaced by “Employees,” “Creators,” “Community,” and “Product Experience.”
They pass a small “Cello” referral card between them as incoming handwritten notes and chat bubbles labeled “word of mouth” flow in, their expressions cautiously hopeful.

scenes.title: Trust-based retention becomes the moat
scenes.main_point: AI commoditized cost and efficiency value props; retention depended on confidence in ongoing outcomes.
scenes.scene_summary: AI commoditized efficiency and cost; customers stayed for teams that shipped, listened, and earned trust.
key_elements: value prop triad: cheaper, more efficient, more effective
AI outcompeting on speed and cost
trust as confidence in better outcomes over time
build in public via real people
scenes.scene_prompt:
Delicate watercolor painting style, soft washes, visible brush strokes, muted tones.
In the same simple startup war-room, the same small team stands together by a whiteboard where “cheaper / more efficient / more effective” is crossed out and “trust” is circled, a transparent roadmap and tiny micro-release notes pinned beside it.
They listen to a customer on a laptop call, calmly updating the roadmap from feedback, a subtle WOW UX sketch on the board, conveying resolved confidence in ongoing outcomes.
